New Records: Shubman Gill scored his first T20I half-century in 36 deliveries.
Ruturaj Gaikwad scored 49 off 28 deliveries, narrowly missing a half-century.
Key Match Events: India won the toss and decided to bat first, setting Zimbabwe a target of 183 runs.
Washington Sundar picked up three wickets for India, contributing significantly to the victory.
Dion Myers and Clive Madande were the top scorers for Zimbabwe, but their efforts were not enough to chase down the target.
Several key wickets fell at crucial moments, including Shubman Gill and Ruturaj Gaikwad's dismissals.
Pre-Game Insights: Yashasvi Jaiswal made his debut for India in the playing XI.
Shubman Gill won the toss and decided to bat first, while Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza emphasized the need for improved batting performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill praised the team's resilience and the performance of the bowlers.
Sikandar Raza highlighted the need for senior players to step up and take responsibility.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Harare Sports Ground.
The series is now 2-1 in favor of India after this victory.
The fourth and fifth T20I matches are scheduled for July 13 and 14, respectively.
Others: India's playing XI included several new faces, including Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sanju Samson.
Zimbabwe's bowling attack struggled to contain India's top order, particularly Shubman Gill and Ruturaj Gaikwad.
